Welcome to Comp2’s documentation!

Python library for a game of poker. Consists of Card-classes (NumberedCard, JackCard, QueenCard, KingCard and AceCard). Aswell as a Enum Suit class, Hand class, StandardDeck class and finally a Pokerhand abstract class with subclasses for all types of pokerhands available.

Author: Benjamin Elm Jonsson 2022, benjamin.elmjonsson@gmail.com

Bases: PlayingCard

class cardlib.Hand(cards=[])

Bases: list

List class representing the hand of a player. Contains a list of cards.

add_card(CardsToAdd)

Adds cards to the hand

Parameters

  • self (object) – hand object

  • CardsToAdd (object or list of objects) – the card(s) to add

best_poker_hand(cards=[])

Sending the cards of the hand to all PokerHand subclasses to determine the best hand available

Parameters

  • self (object) – hand object

  • cards (list) – list of cards

drop_cards(indList)

Drops cards at the index in the list, indList

Parameters

  • self (object) – hand object

  • indList (list) – list of indexes

sort()

Sorts the hand by cardvalue

Parameters

self (object) – hand object

class cardlib.Suit(value)

Bases: Enum

Enum class representing the suits of the cards. This makes it possible to compare suits of cards, which will be useful for the pokerhands.
